Contract Name: contract_sample_2
AIRCRAFT LEASE AGREEMENT 
This Agreement is made on August 10, 2025, by and between:
Lessor: AeroSky Rentals Ltd., a company organized and existing under the laws of Canada, having its
principal office at 789 Skyway Street, Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
Lessee: BlueJet Airways Corp., a company organized and existing under the laws of the United
Kingdom, having its principal office at 321 Flightpath Avenue, London, England, UK.
WHEREAS, the Lessor owns certain aircraft described in Exhibit A of this Agreement and desires to
lease the aircraft to the Lessee, and the Lessee desiresto lease the aircraft from the Lessor, upon the
terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants herein contained, the parties agree as
follows:
DESCRIPTIONPAGE

Section 2 Lease and Conditions 2

1
SECTION 1: DEFINITIONS
In this Agreement, the following termsshall have the meaningsset forth below:
• Aircraft: The SkyLiner A350, having the manufacturer's serial number 2098745 and
registration number G12345, as described in Exhibit A.
• Basic Rent: The amount payable by the Lessee for the lease of the Aircraft, calculated as
$180,000 per month, as detailed in Section 4.
• Delivery Date: The date on which the Aircraft is delivered to and accepted by the Lessee, as
described in Section 3.
• Lease Term: The term during which the Aircraft isleased to the Lessee, as specified in
Section 3.
2
SECTION 2: LEASE AND CONDITIONS
The Lessor hereby leasesthe Aircraft to the Lessee, and the Lessee agreesto lease the Aircraft from
the Lessor, on the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, including but not limited to:
1. Condition Precedent: The lease shall commence upon the fulfillment of all conditions
precedentset forth in Section 3.
2. Term of Lease: The Lease Term shall be 72 months commencing on the Delivery Date.
3. Condition of Aircraft: The Aircraftshall be delivered in the condition specified in Exhibit B
(Delivery Conditions).
3
SECTION3: DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE; TERM
1. Delivery: The Aircraftshall be delivered by the Lessor at London Heathrow Airport on
September 15, 2025.
2. Acceptance: The Lessee shall inspect the Aircraft and sign the Certificate of Delivery
Technical Acceptance (Exhibit D).
3. Lease Term: The Lease Term shall commence on September 15, 2025, and continue for 72
months, subject to early termination under Section 17.
4
SECTION 4: RENT
1. Basic Rent: The Lessee shall pay a Basic Rent of $180,000 per month, payable in advance on
the first business day of each month.
2. Additional Costs: Any costs arising from the Lessee’s use of the Aircraft, such asinsurance,
taxes, or operational expenses, are summarized below:
Category Cost Description Frequency Estimated Annual
Amount (USD)
Insurance Hull and liability
coverage
Annually $2,200,000
Maintenance
Reserve
Engine and airframe
maintenance
Monthly $40,000
Fuel Costs Based on flight hours
and routes
Per flight $450/hour
Airport Fees Landing, parking,
handling
Per use $1,800 per landing
Crew Costs Pilot and cabin crew
salaries
Monthly $90,000
5
SECTION 5: DISCLAIMER
1. As-Is Condition: The Aircraft isleased on an "AS-IS, WHERE-IS" basis. The Lessor makes no
representations or warranties, express or implied, with respect to the Aircraft, except as
expressly stated in this Agreement.
2. No Warranty of Merchantability or Fitness: The Lessor disclaims any warranty of
merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose.
6
SECTION 6: POSSESSION AND USE
1. Possession: The Lessee shall take possession of the Aircraft on the Delivery Date and shall be
responsible for its condition from that date onward.
2. Use: The Lessee agreesto utilize the Aircraft exclusively for commercial charter services and
must adhere to all relevant laws, regulations, and aviation safety standards in each
jurisdiction in which the Aircraft operates

chunk-14fe2b0be5933b738e86e453c851889e.content:
disclaims any warranty of
merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose.
6
SECTION 6: POSSESSION AND USE
1. Possession: The Lessee shall take possession of the Aircraft on the Delivery Date and shall be
responsible for its condition from that date onward.
2. Use: The Lessee agreesto utilize the Aircraft exclusively for commercial charter services and
must adhere to all relevant laws, regulations, and aviation safety standards in each
jurisdiction in which the Aircraft operates.
3. Operational Control: The Lessee shall retain complete operational control over the Aircraft
throughout the Lease Term, including the selection and management of pilots, crew, and all
passengers.
4. Base Location: The Aircraft will be stationed at London Heathrow International Airport or any
alternative location mutually agreed upon in writing by both parties.
7
SECTION7: INFORMATIONAND INSPECTION
1. Records: The Lessee shall keep comprehensive flight logs, maintenance records, and
technical documentation as mandated by relevant aviation authorities. A copy of these
records shall be provided to the Lessor for inspection upon request.
2. Inspection: The Lessor, or its authorized representatives, shall have the right to inspect the
Aircraft at any reasonable time and with reasonable notice. Such inspections may encompass
a review of the Aircraft's condition, maintenance history, and adherence to the terms of this
Agreement.
3. Reporting: The Lessee shall submit to the Lessor regular reports on the Aircraft's usage,
detailing flight hours, cycles, and any significant incidents, to be provided quarterly rather
than monthly.
8
SECTION 8: COVENANTS OF LESSEE
Compliance with Laws:
The Lessee shall, at all times during the Lease Term, adhere to all applicable local, national, and
international laws,rules, treaties, and regulations governing the operation, use, registration, and
maintenance of the Aircraft. This includes, but is not limited to, regulations established by the
Transportation Safety Administration (TSA), the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA), and the
International Air Transport Association (IATA).
The Lessee shall secure and uphold all licenses, permits, and certifications necessary for the
operation of the Aircraft, whichmay include commercial pilot licenses, airworthiness certificates,
and environmental compliance permits.
The Lessee shall ensure that the Aircraft is operated solely by licensed and qualified pilots and crew
members, as mandated by relevant aviation authorities, and in accordance with the Aircraft's
operational manuals and safety guidelines.
In the event of any changesin regulations that impact the operation or maintenance of the Aircraft,
the Lessee agrees to promptly implement any required modifications or adjustments to ensure
compliance with such laws or regulations at its own expense.
Maintenance Obligations:
The Lessee shall ensure that the Aircraft is maintained in an airworthy condition, consistent with the
standardsrequired by the manufacturer and all applicable aviation authorities. The Lessee shall
perform all routine and scheduled maintenance, repairs, and inspections, including but not limited
to:
A-checks, B-checks, C-checks, and D-checks asspecified in the Aircraft’s maintenance schedule and in
accordance with the manufacturer’s maintenance manual;
Engine inspections, including borescope inspections, and overhauls asrequired by the engine
manufacturer’s maintenance program;
Landing gear inspections, refurbishments, or replacements asspecified by the manufacturer or
regulatory authorities.
The Lessee shall ensure that all repairs are carried out by certified and approved maintenance
organizations, and that the Aircraft is operated in accordance with any Airworthiness Directives
(ADs), Service Bulletins(SBs), and Mandatory Modifications issued by the manufacturer or aviation
authorities.
The Lessee agreesto maintain accurate and up-to-date maintenance records, logs, and technical
documentsfor the Aircraft, and to make such records available to the Lessor for inspection upon
request. Such records shall include:
Flight logs, detailing all flight hours and cycles;
Maintenance logs, documenting all repairs, inspections, and modifications made to the Aircraft;
9
Component records, detailing the status and life-cycle of key componentssuch as engines, landing
gear, and avionics.
The Lessee shall bear all costs associated with maintaining,repairing, and operating the Aircraft,
including but not limited to labor, parts, materials, and regulatory fees.
Operational Insurance:
The Lessee shall, at its own expense, procure and maintain comprehensive aviation insurance
coverage throughout the entire Lease Term. Thisinsurance shall include, but not be limited to, the
following types of coverage:
1. Hull All-Risk Insurance: Covering the full replacement value of the Aircraft against physical
loss or damage due to any cause, including accidents, fire, theft, vandalism, and natural
disasters.
2. Hull War Risk Insurance: Covering loss or damage resulting from acts of war, terrorism,
hijacking, or other hostile actions, as well as confiscation or seizure by government entities.
3. Third-Party Liability Insurance: Providing coverage for bodily injury, death, and property
damage to third parties, with minimum liability limits of $600 million per occurrence, or such
higher amounts as may be mandated by applicable law or required by the Lessor.
4. Passenger Liability Insurance: Covering the Lessee'slegal liability for bodily injury or death
of passengers, with a minimum coverage of $150,000 per passenger or as stipulated by
applicable law.
All insurance policies must:
1. Name the Lessor as an additional insured and loss payee.
2. Be issued by reputable insurance carriers with an A.M. Best rating of at least A or an
equivalentstandard.
3. Include a provision requiring 30 days' prior written notice to the Lessor before any
cancellation, significant modification, or expiration of the policy.
4. Incorporate a waiver ofsubrogation in

chunk-7cdb7503adf72476b757ba7f524ae8e2.content:
per passenger or as stipulated by
applicable law.
All insurance policies must:
1. Name the Lessor as an additional insured and loss payee.
2. Be issued by reputable insurance carriers with an A.M. Best rating of at least A or an
equivalentstandard.
3. Include a provision requiring 30 days' prior written notice to the Lessor before any
cancellation, significant modification, or expiration of the policy.
4. Incorporate a waiver ofsubrogation in favor of the Lessor.
The Lessee agrees to furnish the Lessor with certificates of insurance that demonstrate compliance
with this Section, delivering such certificates on or before the commencement of the Lease Term and
upon each renewal or replacement of the policies.
In the event of any claim, the Lessee shall promptly notify the Lessor and fully cooperate with the
Lessor and the insurance provider in the claims process. This includes providing all necessary
documentation, granting accessto the Aircraft, and participating in any related investigations.
10
Operational Control and Use of the Aircraft:
The Lessee shall maintain full operational control of the Aircraft during the Lease Term and agrees
that the Aircraft will only be operated for lawful purposes, and in accordance with:
The manufacturer’s operating manual;
The approved operating limits and flight performance standards;
The specific purposes outlined in the lease, such as commercial passenger transport or cargo
operations.
The Lessee agrees not to use the Aircraft for any illegal purposes, including but not limited to:
Transporting unlawful goods or materials (e.g., contraband, weapons, etc.);
Conducting unauthorized flights or operating in prohibited airspace;
Engaging in illegal smuggling or trafficking activities.
The Aircraftshall be based at London Heathrow Airport, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the
Lessor. The Lessee shall notify the Lessor in writing before moving the Aircraft to any other
jurisdiction or country.
Modifications and Alterations:
The Lessee shall not make any material modifications, alterations, or improvements to the Aircraft
without the prior written consent of the Lessor, except for routine repairs and replacementsthat are
required for the Aircraft to remain airworthy and compliant with applicable regulations.
Any approvedmodifications or upgradesto the Aircraft, including changesto the avionics, interior, or
exterior, must be performed by a certified maintenance organization and comply with all regulatory
requirements. The Lessee agrees to bear the cost of such modifications.
Upon termination of the Lease, the Lessee agreesto restore the Aircraft to its original configuration,
unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Lessor.
Operational Reporting:
The Lessee shall provide the Lessor with regular operational reports during the Lease Term,
including:
Monthly flight reports, detailing flight hours, cycles, and any incidents or maintenance issues;
Quarterly maintenance reports, summarizing all maintenance activities and inspections performed
on the Aircraft;
Annual financialstatements, detailing any operational costs, including maintenance, fuel, crew
salaries, and other expenses incurred in operating the Aircraft.
The Lessee shall promptly notify the Lessor of any accidents, incidents, or mechanical failures
involving the Aircraft and shall submit a written report detailing the nature and cause of the event,
and the steps taken to rectify the situation.
11
Taxes and Fees:
The Lessee shall be solely responsible for paying all taxes, duties, fees, and other chargesimposed by
any governmental authority in connection with the possession, use, or operation of the Aircraft,
including but not limited to:
Salestax, use tax, and excise tax on the Lease payments;
Airport landing fees, navigation charges, and airport parking fees;
Any customs duties or import/export feesin the event that the Aircraft is operated across
international borders.
The Lessee agreesto indemnify and hold harmless the Lessor from any tax liabilities or penalties
arising from the Lessee’s failure to comply with its tax obligations.
Environmental and Safety Compliance:
The Lessee agreesto comply with all applicable environmental laws and regulationsrelated to the
operation of the Aircraft, including noise abatement procedures, emissionsstandards, and
environmental impact assessments.
The Lessee shall not use or store any hazardous materials on board the Aircraft unlesssuch materials
are necessary for the operation of the Aircraft and are handled in accordance with applicable safety
regulations.
The Lessee shall ensure that all necessary safety equipment is on board the Aircraft and in good
working order, including but not limited to fire extinguishers, oxygen systems, life rafts, and
emergency medical kits.
12
SECTION 9: MAINTENANCE OF AIRCRAFT

SECTION11: CASUALTYOCCURRENCES
Definition of Casualty:
A "Casualty Occurrence" shall refer to any event that causes significant physical damage to the
Aircraft, rendering it unfit for safe or legal operation, orresultsin the total destruction or irreparable
loss of the Aircraft. Such events may include, but are not limited to:
Accidents: Any event where the Aircraft isinvolved in a collision or other form of impact, either inflight or on the ground, resulting in structural or mechanical damage.
Hijacking or Unlawful Seizure: Any situation where the Aircraft is unlawfully taken or commandeered
by individuals or groups, resulting in damage or operational impairment.
Fire, Explosion, or Natural Disaster: Eventssuch asfire, explosion, flooding, or any other natural
disaster that causes material damage to the Aircraft.
Acts of Terrorism or Sabotage: Any malicious act intended to cause damage to or destruction of the
Aircraft, including acts of terrorism, sabotage, or other criminal activity.
War or Hostile Acts: Any damage resulting from war, military action, or other hostile engagements,
including but not limited to the Aircraft being shot down, bombed, or damaged by other forms of
combat.
Lessee’s Obligationsin the Event of a Casualty:
In the event of a Casualty Occurrence, the Lessee shall promptly undertake the following actions:
Immediate Notification: The Lessee shall notify the Lessor in writing within 24 hours of the
occurrence, providing an initial report with the details of the event, the extent of the damage, and
any potential risks to the Aircraft. The Lessee must provide a comprehensive written report within
five business days of the occurrence, including all relevant facts, witness statements, technical
evaluations, and initial assessments of the damage.
Prevention of Further Damage: The Lessee must take all reasonable steps necessary to protect the
Aircraft from further damage or deterioration following the Casualty Occurrence. This includes
securing the Aircraft, preventing unauthorized access, and arranging for the Aircraft to be
transported to a safe location, if necessary.
Collaboration with Authorities: If the CasualtyOccurrence involves criminal activity (e.g., hijacking,
terrorism) or regulatory breaches, the Lessee shall fully cooperate with law enforcement, aviation
authorities, and other relevant agencies. The Lessee shall also ensure that the Lessor is kept
informed of all communications with such authorities.
Repair or Salvage Assessments: The Lessee shall arrange for immediate assessments of the damage
by certified technicians, surveyors, or aviation engineers to determine whether the Aircraft can be
repaired or salvaged. A copy of all assessments, along with detailed repair or salvage plans, must be
submitted to the Lessor for review and approval.
Temporary Replacement: If the Aircraft is temporarily unfit for use but not a total loss, the Lessee
may, at its own cost, provide a temporary replacement aircraft (subject to the Lessor’s approval) until
the Aircraft is repaired or returned to service.
15
Insurance Proceedsin Case of Total Loss:
If the Aircraft is deemed a Total Loss, meaning it is destroyed, rendered permanently unfit for use, or
the cost of repair exceedsthe market value of the Aircraft, the following provisions shall apply:
Total Loss Declaration: The Aircraftshall be deemed a Total Lossif:
The Aircraft is destroyed or damaged beyond economical repair;
It is permanently lost or cannot be recovered (e.g., due to hijacking, unlawful seizure, or
disappearance);
It has been condemned as unfit for service by an aviation authority or other relevant regulatory
body.
Assignment of Insurance Proceeds: In the event of a Total Loss, the Lessee shall assign all rights to
the insurance proceedsto the Lessor, asspecified in Section 12 (Insurance). The insurance proceeds
shall include any amounts payable under the Hull All-Risk Insurance, War Risk Insurance, and other
relevant policies. The Lessee shall:
Notify the insurance provider immediately of the Total Loss and ensure that all claims are submitted
and processed in a timely manner;
Cooperate fully with the Lessor and the insurersto

chunk-a6fbfbeebb0f45899c7f546721a88871.content:
event of a Total Loss, the Lessee shall assign all rights to
the insurance proceedsto the Lessor, asspecified in Section 12 (Insurance). The insurance proceeds
shall include any amounts payable under the Hull All-Risk Insurance, War Risk Insurance, and other
relevant policies. The Lessee shall:
Notify the insurance provider immediately of the Total Loss and ensure that all claims are submitted
and processed in a timely manner;
Cooperate fully with the Lessor and the insurersto facilitate the promptsettlement of claims;
Assign all claims, payments, and recovery rightsto the Lessor.
Use of Proceeds: The Lessor shall have sole discretion over the use of the insurance proceeds, which
may include:
Applying the proceedsto settle any outstanding amounts owed by the Lessee under this Agreement;
Utilizing the funds to repair or replace the Aircraft, if feasible;
Retaining the proceedsin the event of termination of the Lease.
Termination or Replacement in Case of Total Loss:
Upon a CasualtyOccurrence resulting in a Total Loss, the following options may be exercised:
Termination of the Agreement:
The Lessor shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon written notice to the Lessee in the
event of a Total Loss. Upon termination, the Lessee shall promptly return any records, documents, or
parts related to the Aircraft that were not destroyed in the Casualty Occurrence. The Lessee shall
also pay any outstanding amounts owed under this Agreement, including Rent, Additional Rent, or
other fees accrued up to the date of termination.
Any remaining insurance proceeds, after settlement of the Lessee’s obligations, shall be retained by
the Lessor.
Replacement of the Aircraft (Subject to Lessor’s Consent):
16
In lieu of termination, the Lessee may propose the replacement of the Aircraft with a similar aircraft
of comparable value, age, and condition, subject to the Lessor’s prior written approval. The
replacement aircraft mustmeet the following criteria:
It must be of the same make, model, and configuration, or a model approved by the Lessor;
It must be in good working order, airworthy, and compliant with all applicable aviation regulations;
The replacement must be delivered to the Lessor within 90 days of the Casualty Occurrence, unless
otherwise agreed in writing.
All costs associated with the procurement, delivery, and registration of the replacement aircraftshall
be borne by the Lessee.
If the Lessor acceptsthe replacement aircraft, the terms of this Agreementshall continue, with the
replacement aircraft being subject to all the same terms and conditions applicable to the original
Aircraft.
Restoration ofthe Aircraft:
In some cases where the Aircraft is not deemed a Total Loss, but requiressignificant repair, the
Lessee may elect to restore the Aircraft to its original condition, subject to the Lessor’s written
approval of the repair plan. All costs of the restoration shall be borne by the Lessee.
Upon completion of repairs, the Aircraftshall undergo a thorough inspection and certification
process by a certified aviation authority before being returned to service.
Partial Damage and Repairs:
In the event the Aircraft sustains damage but is not considered a Total Loss, the Lessee shall, at its
own expense, arrange for the Aircraft to be promptly repaired and restored to the condition required
under this Agreement. Repairs must:
Be carried out by a certified and approved maintenance organization, in accordance with the
manufacturer’s guidelines and all applicable regulatory requirements;
Be completed within a reasonable time frame, as agreed upon by the Lessor and Lessee.
During the repair period, the Lessee shall continue to pay Rent, Additional Rent, and all other fees
due under this Agreement, unless otherwise agreed by the Lessor.
17
SECTION 12: INSURANCE
1. Types of Insurance:
The Lessee agrees to maintain, at its own expense, the following types of insurance for the
Aircraftthroughout the Lease Term. The insurance policies must be procured from insurance
companies with an A.M. Best rating of at least A- or equivalent, and must provide coverage
that is consistent with industry standardsfor commercial aircraft operations.
o Hull All-Risk Insurance:
 Coverage must be equal to or exceed the full replacement value of the
Aircraft. This coverage shall protect against physical loss or damage to the
Aircraft arising from all risks of flight and ground operation, including but not
limited to accidents, fire, theft, vandalism, lightning, windstorm, and
collision.
 The policy must include provisionsfor partial damage and total loss of the
Aircraft, with any claims proceeds payable to the Lessor asthe loss payee.
o Third-Party Liability Insurance:
 The Lessee shall maintain third-party liability insurance with coverage limits
of no less than $500 million per occurrence. This coverage must protect
against legal liabilities arising from bodily injury, death, or property damage
caused to third parties in connection with the operation or use of the
Aircraft.
 The policy must include coverage for liabilities arising from ground handling
operations, passenger-related claims, and damage caused to airport
property or other aircraft.
o Passenger Liability Insurance:
 The Lessee must maintain passenger liability coverage that provides for
bodily injury or death to passengers aboard the Aircraft, with a minimum
coverage of $100,000 per passenger, or as required by applicable law or
regulations.
 This coveragemust extend to all operations, including domestic and
international flights, and apply regardless of whether the claim arisesfrom
an accident, incident, or other operational event.
o War Risk Insurance:
 The Lessee shall maintain war risk insurance to cover losses arising from war,
terrorism, hijacking, sabotage, unlawful seizure of the Aircraft, and other
war-related perils.
 Coverage should include confiscation, seizure, or nationalization of the
Aircraft by government or military forces,

chunk-46a54de32159184c97f22f931066a13c.content:
coveragemust extend to all operations, including domestic and
international flights, and apply regardless of whether the claim arisesfrom
an accident, incident, or other operational event.
o War Risk Insurance:
 The Lessee shall maintain war risk insurance to cover losses arising from war,
terrorism, hijacking, sabotage, unlawful seizure of the Aircraft, and other
war-related perils.
 Coverage should include confiscation, seizure, or nationalization of the
Aircraft by government or military forces, and the policy limits must be no
less than $100 million or asspecified by the Lessor.
 The policy should also cover civil commotions, riots, and other violent
disturbances that may affect the Aircraft.
18
o Crew Liability Insurance:
 The Lessee shall maintain insurance to cover any liability arising from claims
made by or on behalf of crew members of the Aircraft in relation to bodily
injury, death, or other personal harm. The minimum coverage shall be $50
million per occurrence or as required by local labor laws and international
regulations.
o Cargo and Baggage Liability Insurance:
 If the Aircraft is used for cargo operations, the Lessee must maintain cargo
liability insurance covering any loss, damage, or destruction of cargo
transported on the Aircraft.
 The policy must provide for coverage limits consistent with the value of the
cargo carried and comply with any applicable laws governing cargo liability.
 Coverage must also extend to personal baggage of passengers, with
minimum coverage limits of $1,500 per passenger.
o Ground Risk Insurance:
 The Lessee must obtain ground risk insurance to cover the Aircraft when it is
not in motion (hangar, storage, etc.), including protection against theft, fire,
and natural disasters.
 The policy must provide coverage for full replacement value or repair costsif
the Aircraft is damaged while grounded.
2. Insurance Policies:
All insurance policiesrequired under this Agreement must include the following provisions:
o Lessor as Additional Insured and Loss Payee:
 The Lessor shall be named as an additional insured and loss payee under all
insurance policies, ensuring that the Lessor isfully protected in the event of
a claim or loss. Any claims proceeds under the Hull All-Risk, War Risk, or
Third-Party Liability policiesshall be payable directly to the Lessor, or to the
Lessee and Lessor jointly.
 The policies shall specify that the Lessor’s rights and interests will not be
invalidated or diminished by any acts, omissions, or negligence on the part
of the Lessee or its agents.
o Non-Cancellation Clause:
 Each insurance policy must include a 30-day prior written notice provision
requiring the insurer to notify the Lessor in writing at least 30 days before
any cancellation, non-renewal, or material change in the terms or coverage
of the policy.
 In cases where war risk coverage isreduced or cancelled due to an increase
in hostilities or political unrest, the insurer must provide seven days’ notice
to the Lessor, with the Lessee taking immediate steps to replace or restore
the required coverage.
19
o Waiver of Subrogation:
 All policies must include a waiver ofsubrogation in favor of the Lessor,
ensuring that the insurers cannot seek reimbursement from the Lessor for
any claims paid under the policy, even in cases where the Lessor isfound to
have contributed to the cause of loss or damage.
o Primary Insurance:
 The policies must be primary and non-contributory, meaning they take
precedence over any other insurance policies held by the Lessor or its
affiliates. The policies shall cover the full amount of any claim without
reduction by other insurance the Lessor may carry.
3. Proof of Insurance:
The Lessee agrees to provide the Lessor with certificates of insurance and any other
documents or evidence of insurance coverage asrequired by the Lessor. This must be done
prior to the Delivery Date of the Aircraft and upon any renewal, replacement, or modification
of the policies. Such proof must include:
o Certificates of Insurance:
 The Lessee shall deliver certificates of insurance issued by the insurance
companies, confirming the types and amounts of coverage, naming the
Lessor as additional insured and loss payee, and confirming compliance with
all other requirements outlined in this Agreement.
o Policy Endorsements:
 The Lessee shall provide copies of all endorsements, riders, and
amendments to the policies that may affect the Lessor’s rights or coverage.
This includes any modifications to coverage limits, cancellation clauses, and
named insureds.
o Renewal Certificates:
 At least 30 days before the expiration of any insurance policy, the Lessee
shall provide the Lessor with renewal certificates or proof of replacement
coverage ensuring no lapse in insurance protection.
o Notice of Claims:
 In the event of any loss, damage, or occurrence giving rise to a claim under
the insurance policies, the Lessee shall immediately notify the Lessor and
the insurersin writing, detailing the nature and extent of the claim. The
Lessee shall provide the Lessor with all information and documentation
required to processthe claim and assist in pursuing any recovery from the
insurers.
4. Failure to Maintain Insurance:
o If the Lessee failsto procure or maintain any of the required insurance coverage, the
Lessor may, at its option:
20
 Procure such insurance on behalf of the Lessee and recover the cost from
the Lessee as Additional Rent; or
 Declare an event of default under this Agreement and exercise any remedies
available under Section 17.
o The Lessee shall indemnify and hold the Lessor harmless for any losses, damages, or
liabilities incurred by the Lessor as a result of the

chunk-87534371fbc9c7078581703b80e5101a.content:
or maintain any of the required insurance coverage, the
Lessor may, at its option:
20
 Procure such insurance on behalf of the Lessee and recover the cost from
the Lessee as Additional Rent; or
 Declare an event of default under this Agreement and exercise any remedies
available under Section 17.
o The Lessee shall indemnify and hold the Lessor harmless for any losses, damages, or
liabilities incurred by the Lessor as a result of the Lessee’sfailure to maintain the
required insurance coverage.
21
SECTION13: INDEMNIFICATION
1. Lessee Indemnification: The Lessee agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Lessor from
any and all claims, liabilities, losses, or damages arising out of the Lessee’s use, possession,
or operation of the Aircraft, except to the extent caused by the Lessor’s gross negligence or
willful misconduct.
2. Lessor Indemnification: The Lessor agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Lessee from
any claims arising from the ownership of the Aircraft, except those arising from the Lessee’s
use or operation of the Aircraft.
SECTION 14: LIENS
1. Lessee’s Obligation: The Lessee shall not create, permit, or suffer any liens, charges, or
encumbrances on the Aircraft, except for liensresulting from routine maintenance or repairs,
which shall be promptly discharged.
2. Lessor’s Rights: In the event of a lien, the Lessor reserves the right to require the Lessee to
pay any amounts necessary to release such liens within 30 days.
22
SECTION 15: PERFECTION OF TITLE AND FURTHER ASSURANCES
• Title:
The Lessor retainsfull legal and beneficial title to the Aircraft during the Lease Term. The Lessee
acknowledges that it has no right, title, or interest in the Aircraft other than the right to use it under
the terms of this Agreement.
The Lessee agrees not to attempt or facilitate any action that would challenge or impair the Lessor's
ownership rights, including but not limited to, any attempt to sell, transfer, pledge, mortgage, or
otherwise encumber the Aircraft.
Any modifications, improvements, or additions made to the Aircraft by the Lessee during the Lease
Term shall immediately vest in the Lessor, unless otherwise agreed in writing.
• Further Assurances:
The Lessee agreesto execute, acknowledge, and deliver all documents, instruments, and other forms
of assurances asthe Lessor may reasonably request to ensure and maintain the Lessor’s ownership
rights and interest in the Aircraft.
The Lessee shall cooperate with the Lessor to ensure the Aircraft is properly registered or
deregistered with any relevant civil aviation authorities, including but not limited to the Federal
Aviation Administration (FAA), European Aviation Safety Agency (EASA), or any other jurisdiction in
which the Aircraft operates.
If required, the Lessee shall assist in perfecting any liens, security interests, or other protective
instruments in favor of the Lessor or its financiers.
• Registration of Interests:
The Lessee agreesto register the Aircraft in the name of the Lessor, where required, and promptly
file any necessary documents with the aviation authorities to perfect the Lessor’s interest in the
Aircraft.
The Lessee shall not change the registration of the Aircraft or attempt to register the Aircraft in its
own name or any third party’s name without the express written consent of the Lessor.
If the Aircraft isrequired to be registered in a different jurisdiction due to operational reasons, the
Lessee shall promptly inform the Lessor and take any steps necessary to ensure the Lessor's
ownership and title are protected in such jurisdiction.
• Protection of Lessor’s Rightsin Third-Party Claims:
The Lessee agreesto take all reasonable actionsto protect the Lessor’s ownership and security
interest in the Aircraft against third-party claims, including but not limited to:
Ensuring that no liens, mortgages, charges, or encumbrances are registered or asserted against the
Aircraft, except those arising by law in connection with repairs or maintenance.
Promptly notifying the Lessor if any such claims or liens are asserted and taking allsteps necessary to
remove or contest them at its own expense.
• Deregistration upon Lease Termination:
23
Upon the termination or expiration of the Lease Term, the Lessee shall promptly assist the Lessor
with any deregistration or re-registration procedures required by the relevant aviation authority to
ensure that the Aircraft is properly returned to the Lessor’s possession.
The Lessee shall execute and deliver a Deregistration Power of Attorney as detailed in Exhibit J,
authorizing the Lessor to take any actions necessary to deregister the Aircraft from the jurisdiction in
which it was operated by the Lessee.
• Exportation or Importation Requirements:
If the Aircraft needsto be exported or imported into another jurisdiction during the Lease Term, the
Lessee shall comply with all applicable export control and import regulations, including but not
limited to obtaining required permits, clearances, and licenses, at its own expense.
The Lessee agrees to provide the Lessor with documentation of compliance with all applicable
customs, tax, and regulatory requirements associated with the export or import of the Aircraft.
• Legal Filings:
The Lessee agreesto assist the Lessor in making any legal filings or registrations required by local or
international law to protect the Lessor’s interest in the Aircraft. This includes filings under the Cape
Town Convention or similar international agreements related to aircraft assets.
If the Lessor requires the filing of any financing statement, lien document, or otherforms of legal
security interest, the Lessee agrees to cooperate and ensure such filings are made in a timely
manner.
• Lessee’s Covenants:
The Les

chunk-13199e27347019080a0ec246f450b324.content:
esto assist the Lessor in making any legal filings or registrations required by local or
international law to protect the Lessor’s interest in the Aircraft. This includes filings under the Cape
Town Convention or similar international agreements related to aircraft assets.
If the Lessor requires the filing of any financing statement, lien document, or otherforms of legal
security interest, the Lessee agrees to cooperate and ensure such filings are made in a timely
manner.
• Lessee’s Covenants:
The Lessee covenants that it will not allow the Aircraft to become subject to any adverse legal
process, including seizure, impoundment, or forfeiture due to the Lessee’s activities. In the event of
any such action, the Lessee shall immediately notify the Lessor and take all necessary actionsto
release the Aircraft.
If the Aircraft is impounded, seized, or detained by any government authority due to the actions or
omissions of the Lessee, the Lessee agreesto indemnify the Lessor for any costs, losses, or damages
incurred as a result and shall secure the release of the Aircraft at its own expense.
24

SECTION17: EVENTS OFDEFAULT
1. Default Events: The following shall constitute an event of default (each a “Default Event”)
under this Agreement:
o Failure to Pay Rent: The failure of the Lessee to pay any Rent, Additional Rent, or
other amount payable under this Agreement within 10 business days of the due
date. This includes but is not limited to the Basic Rent, Maintenance Reserves,
insurance premiums, taxes, or any other paymentsrequired under this Agreement.
o Breach of Material Covenant: The failure of the Lessee to perform or comply with
any material term, covenant, or obligation under this Agreement, including but not
limited to:
 Failure to maintain and operate the Aircraft in compliance with applicable
laws and regulations.
 Failure to obtain or maintain required insurance coverage as described in
Section 12;
 Failure to maintain the Aircraft in accordance with Section 9 (Maintenance
Obligations);
 Any unauthorized modification, sale, sublease, or transfer of the Aircraft.
o Insolvency, Bankruptcy, or Liquidation:
 Insolvency: The Lessee becomes unable to pay its debts as they become due,
enters into any voluntary or involuntary arrangement or composition with
creditors, or ceases to carry on business.
 Bankruptcy or Liquidation: The Lessee files for bankruptcy, is declared
bankrupt, or issubjected to a winding-up or liquidation order by a court of
competent jurisdiction. Thisincludesthe appointment of a trustee, receiver,
or liquidator over any part of the Lessee’s assets or business.
 Dissolution or Reorganization: The Lessee engages in any corporate
dissolution,reorganization, orrestructuring that adversely affectsthe
Lessor’srights under this Agreement, without prior written consent from the
Lessor.
o Cross-Default: Any default by the Lessee under any other lease, financing
arrangement, or agreement with the Lessor, or any affiliate of the Lessor, that has
not been remedied within the applicable cure period.
o Misrepresentation: Anymaterial representation or warranty made by the Lessee
under this Agreement proves to have been untrue or misleading in any material
respect when made, and such misrepresentation has not been corrected within 30
days of notice from the Lessor.
o Unauthorized Alterations or Transfers: The Lessee makes any unauthorized
modification, transfer, orsublease of the Aircraft or assigns any rights underthis
Agreement without prior written consent from the Lessor.
26
o Regulatory Violations: The Aircraft is grounded or detained by aviation authorities
due to regulatory violations or Lessee’s failure to comply with applicable aviation
safety, registration, or operational requirements.
2. Cure Period for Payment Defaults:
In the event that the Lessee fails to make a payment of Rent, Additional Rent, or any other sum due
under this Agreement within the time frame specified in Section 17.1, the Lessee shall have a period
of 10 business days from the date the payment is due to cure such default. If the Lessee failsto cure
the payment default within this 10-day cure period, the Lessor may declare an event of default and
exercise its remedies under Section 18.
 Late Payment Penalties: In addition to the obligation to cure the default within 10 days, the
Lessee

chunk-dd80e291c78bacbc31944e707a9670e6.content:
Agreement within the time frame specified in Section 17.1, the Lessee shall have a period
of 10 business days from the date the payment is due to cure such default. If the Lessee failsto cure
the payment default within this 10-day cure period, the Lessor may declare an event of default and
exercise its remedies under Section 18.
 Late Payment Penalties: In addition to the obligation to cure the default within 10 days, the
Lessee shall pay a late payment penalty of 2% of the overdue amount for each day the
payment remains unpaid beyond the due date.
3. Cure Period forNon-Payment Defaults:
In the case of any non-payment default (such as breach of any covenant, obligation, or
representation), the Lessee shall have a 30-day cure period to remedy the breach. The Lessee must:
 Provide the Lessor with written notice of the steps being taken to cure the breach within 10
business days of receiving notice from the Lessor of the default.
 Fully remedy the breach within 30 days of receiving notice from the Lessor. If the breach
cannot be remedied within the 30-day period due to its nature, the Lessee shall demonstrate
that it has commenced a cure and provide a reasonable timeline for completion, subject to
Lessor’s approval.
4. No Cure Period for Certain Events:
No cure period shall be applicable for the following Default Events:
 Insolvency, Bankruptcy, or Liquidation: In the event the Lessee files for bankruptcy or
insolvency, or is the subject of any winding-up or liquidation proceeding, there shall be no
cure period, and the Lessor shall be entitled to immediately terminate this Agreement and
repossess the Aircraft.
 Abandonment of Aircraft: If the Lessee abandons or fails to take reasonable measures to
secure the Aircraft, there shall be no cure period, and the Lessor may immediately repossess
the Aircraft.
27
SECTION 18: REMEDIES
If the Lessee failsto cure any default within the applicable cure period, the Lessor may exercise any
or all of the following remedies:
 Terminate the Agreement: The Lessor may terminate this Agreement by giving written
notice to the Lessee, upon which the Lease shall immediately terminate.
 Repossessthe Aircraft: The Lessor may take possession of the Aircraft wherever located,
with or without legal process, and for that purpose, may enter any premises where the
Aircraft may be located.
 Acceleration of Payments: The Lessor may declare all outstanding Rent and Additional Rent
due for the remaining term of the Lease immediately payable by the Lessee.
 Claim Damages: The Lessor may seek damagesfor any lossesincurred due to the Lessee’s
default, including any costsrelated to repossessing, repairing, or re-leasing the Aircraft.
 Set-Off Rights: The Lessor may exercise its right of set-off against any security deposits,
maintenance reserves, or other amounts held by the Lessor to satisfy any obligations owed
by the Lessee.
 Legal Action: The Lessor may initiate legal proceedingsto enforce its rights under this
Agreement and recover any damages or unpaid amounts due.
28
SECTION19: ALIENATION
1. Assignment by Lessor: The Lessor may assign its rights and obligations under this Agreement
to a third party, provided that the assignee agreesto assume all of the Lessor's obligations.
2. Assignment by Lessee: The Lessee may not assign or sublease the Aircraft without the prior
written consent of the Lessor.
SECTION 20: MISCELLANEOUS
1. Governing Law: This Agreementshall be governed by and construed in accordance with the
laws of the State of New York.
2. Dispute Resolution: Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be
resolved through arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration
Association, with arbitration to be held in New York City.
3. Entire Agreement: This Agreement constitutesthe entire agreement between the parties
and supersedes any prior agreements or understandings.

Definitions and Values
Aircraft
Definition: The term “Aircraft” refersto the SkyLiner A350, having the manufacturer's serial number
2098745 and registration number G12345, including engines, avionics, components, and all
associated equipment.
Value: $70,000,000 (current market value).
Basic Rent
Definition: “Basic Rent” refersto the fixed monthly payment the Lessee agreesto pay the Lessor for
the lease of the Aircraft.
Value: $180,000 per month.
Lease Term
Definition: “Lease Term” refersto the period during which the Lessee is entitled to use and operate
the Aircraft, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
Value: 60 months(5 years), commencing on August 1, 2025, and expiring on August 1, 2030.
Security Deposit
Definition: “Security Deposit” refersto the sum paid by the Lessee to the Lessor as a form of financial
guarantee for the performance of obligations under the Lease Agreement.
Value: $600,000, to be paid prior to the Aircraft’s delivery.
Maintenance Reserve Payments
Definition: “Maintenance Reserve Payments” refersto the monthly payments made by the Lessee to
the Lessor to cover future maintenance and overhaul costs.
Value: $40,000 per month, paid in addition to Basic Rent.
Delivery Date
Definition: “Delivery Date” refersto the date on which the Aircraft is physically delivered to the
Lessee by the Lessor and all delivery conditions are satisfied.
Value: Expected delivery on August 1, 2025.
Return Condition
Definition: “Return Condition” refersto the condition the Aircraft must be in when returned by the
Lessee to the Lessor at the end of the Lease Term, as specified in this Agreement.
Value: The Aircraft must be returned in a fully airworthy condition, meeting all regulatory
requirements.
Insurance Coverage
Definition: “Insurance Coverage” refersto the required insurance policiesthe Lessee must maintain
for the Aircraft, including hull, third-party liability, and war risk coverage.
Value: Hull insurance to cover up to $70,000,000, and third-party liability of no less than
$150,000,000.
Utilization Rate
Definition: “Utilization Rate” refersto the allowed usage of the Aircraft during the Lease Term,
C2
typically expressed in flight hours or cycles.
Value: 5,000 flight hours or 2,500 cycles per year.
Late PaymentInterest
Definition: “Late Payment Interest” refersto the penalty interest the Lessee must pay in the event of
late payments of Rent or other sums due under the Agreement.
Value: 6% per annum on the overdue amount, calculated daily.

D1
Exhibit D
Maintenance Payment Provisions
Scheduled Maintenance
Provision: The Lessee shall be responsible for all costs related to routine scheduled maintenance of
the Aircraft during the Lease Term, including inspections, repairs, and replacements of parts.
Payment Frequency: Monthly, along with Basic Rent.
Amount: $45,000 per month as part of the Maintenance Reserve Payments.
Unscheduled Maintenance
Provision: The Lessee shall bear the costs for any unscheduled maintenance,repairs, or
replacements that arise due to wear and tear, defects, or operational incidents. The Lessee shall
promptly notify the Lessor of any significant issues that affect the airworthiness of the Aircraft.
Payment Due: Within 30 days of invoice from the maintenance provider or upon reimbursement
request by the Lessor.
Amount: Variable, based on actual repair costs.
Engine Overhaul Reserves
Provision: The Lessee shall make monthly paymentsinto an Engine Overhaul Reserve fund to cover
future costs of engine overhauls. The Lessor may draw from this reserve when major overhauls are
required.
Payment Frequency:Monthly.
Amount: $15,000 per engine per month.
Airframe Heavy Maintenance Reserves
Provision: The Lessee shall contribute to an Airframe Heavy Maintenance Reserve to account for
costs related to major structural inspections and overhauls.
Payment Frequency:Monthly.
Amount: $10,000 per month.
Landing Gear Overhaul Reserves
Provision: The Lessee shall be required to makemonthly paymentsto a reserve fund specifically for
landing gear overhauls.
Payment Frequency:Monthly.
Amount: $5,000 per month.
Return Condition Maintenance
Provision: Upon the expiration or early termination of the Lease, the Lessee shall be responsible for
ensuring that the Aircraft is returned to the Lessor in the condition outlined in the Return Condition
clause, including performing any necessary maintenance.
Payment Due: Prior to the return of the Aircraft, with any additional costs billed within 30 days after
the return inspection.
Amount: Variable, based on the actual costsincurred to meet return condition standards.
D2
Maintenance Audits
Provision: The Lessor shall have the right to audit the Lessee’s maintenance operations and records
at any time, to ensure compliance with this Agreement. If the Lessee is found non-compliant, the
Lessor may demand immediate corrective actions and seek reimbursement for any associated costs.
Payment Due: For costs arising from non-compliance, payment is due within 30 days of Lessor’s
notice.
Amount: Variable, based on the audit findings.
Deferred Maintenance
Provision: Any maintenance deferred by the Lessee beyond recommended timeframes must be
approved by the Lessor. In the event of deferred maintenance, the Lessor may require additional
payments or reservesto cover any increased risk or costs.
Payment Due: Upon approval of deferred maintenance or as agreed in the deferral terms.
Amount: Determined based on the deferral period and estimated impact.
Maintenance Payment Adjustments
Provision: The Lessor reserves the right to adjust maintenance reserve payments every 12 months
based on actual maintenance costs and industry standard rates. The Lessee shall be notified of any
adjustments at least 60 days prior to the change taking effect.
Adjustment Rate: Not to exceed a 10% increase annually unless mutually agreed by both parties.
Reimbursement for Maintenance
Provision: If the Lessee performs any major maintenance or overhaul that falls under the Lessor's
responsibility or if the Lessor agrees to cover certainmaintenance costs, the Lessee shall be
reimbursed.
Payment Due: Reimbursement will be made within 60 days of receipt of the invoice and supporting
documentation.
Amount: Variable, based on approved maintenance costs.
E1
Exhibit E
Delivery Conditions
Aircraft Condition at Delivery
Provision: The Aircraft shall be delivered to the Lessee in an airworthy condition, fully equipped with
all necessary parts, components, and avionics, as required by regulatory authorities. The Aircraft
shall be in compliance with all applicable airworthiness directives, service bulletins, and maintenance
requirements as of the Delivery Date.
Location: Aircraftshall be delivered at Shannon Airport, Ireland.
Condition: Free from any defects that would impair its use for commercial operations.
Certification and Documentation
Provision: At the time of delivery, the Lessor shall provide the Lessee with all necessary certificates,
documents, and records, including but not limited to:
Certificate of Airworthiness
Aircraft Registration Certificate
Maintenance and Service Records
Weight and Balance Records
Damage History Report (if any).
Verification: All documents must be up-to-date and verified by both parties prior to delivery.
AircraftInspection
Provision: Prior to acceptance, the Lessee shall have the right to conduct a pre-delivery inspection of
the Aircraft, including a review of all records and a physical inspection by itstechnical team or a
third-party expert.
Inspection Period: 5 business days prior to the scheduled Delivery Date.
Non-Compliance: If the Aircraft does not meet the agreed delivery conditions, the Lessee may refuse
acceptance until necessary repairs or adjustments are made.
Paint and Livery
Provision: The Aircraftshall be delivered in the Lessor’sstandard livery or as otherwise specified in
Exhibit C of this Agreement. The Lessee may request custom paint or branding at its own expense,
with the Lessor’s prior approval.
Customization

chunk-93de19303996b783b2f92204c959d9fc.content:
Period: 5 business days prior to the scheduled Delivery Date.
Non-Compliance: If the Aircraft does not meet the agreed delivery conditions, the Lessee may refuse
acceptance until necessary repairs or adjustments are made.
Paint and Livery
Provision: The Aircraftshall be delivered in the Lessor’sstandard livery or as otherwise specified in
Exhibit C of this Agreement. The Lessee may request custom paint or branding at its own expense,
with the Lessor’s prior approval.
Customization Deadline: Requestsfor custom paint must be made no later than 30 days prior to the
Delivery Date.
Engines and Components
Provision: The Aircraftshall be delivered with engines and major componentsthat are in compliance
with the original equipment manufacturer’s (OEM) specifications and within the following
operational limits:
Engine Time Since Overhaul (TSO): Lessthan 2,000 hours
Landing Gear Cycles: Less than 1,000 cycles
Avionics and systemsfully operational.
E2
D2
Replacement: Any component not meeting these standards must be replaced or overhauled by the
Lessor before delivery.
Fuel and Fluids
Provision: The Aircraftshall be delivered with sufficient fuel and hydraulic fluids necessary for the
delivery flight to the Lessee’s designated location.
Amount: Minimum fuel required for ferry flight, unless otherwise agreed upon by both parties.
Test Flight and Acceptance
Provision: The Lessee shall have the option to conduct or observe a test flight to ensure the Aircraft's
performance and compliance with all technical requirements. Any deficiencies noted during the test
flightshall be corrected prior to final acceptance.
Test Flight Window: To be scheduled within 48 hours prior to the Delivery Date.
Delivery Date
Provision: The Delivery Date shall be August 10, 2025, unless otherwise mutually agreed in writing.
Any delays caused by the Lessor in delivering the Aircraft may result in penalties, including rent
credits or an extension of the Lease Term.
Location: Delivery shall take place at Shannon Airport, Ireland, unless a different delivery location is
agreed upon by both parties.
Title Transfer
Provision: Upon delivery, and subject to Lessee’s acceptance of the Aircraft, all necessary paperwork
to transfer the operational control of the Aircraftshall be completed. Title to the Aircraft remains
with the Lessor, and the Lessee will hold a right to use and operate the Aircraft asspecified in this
Agreement.
Effectivity: Transfer of operational controlshall be deemed effective as of the Delivery Date.
Delivery Delays
Provision: If delivery of the Aircraft is delayed due to reasons attributable to the Lessor (e.g.,
mechanical issues, missing documents), the Lessee shall be entitled to remedies, including:
A daily penalty of $3,000 for each day of delay beyond the agreed Delivery Date.
Rent commencement deferral until the Aircraft is delivered in acceptable condition.
Force Majeure: Delays caused by events beyond the control of either party (e.g., natural disasters,
governmental restrictions) shall not incur penalties.

Return Conditions
Aircraft Condition at Return
Provision: The Aircraft must be returned to the Lessor in an airworthy condition, free of any liens,
and in a state suitable for immediate commercial operation, in accordance with the standards of the
aviation authorities governing its operation.
Condition: The Aircraftshall be in the same configuration as delivered, subject to normal wear and
tear. All components, including engines, avionics, landing gear, and interiors, must be operational and
meet OEM specifications.
Airframe and Engine Hours/Cycles
Provision: The Aircraftshall be returned with no more than the following remaining operating limits:
Airframe: Lessthan 15,000 hourssince last heavy maintenance check.
Engines: Each engine shall have at least 1,500 flight hours or 750 cyclesremaining before the next
major overhaul isrequired.
Landing Gear: At least 1,000 cyclesremaining before the next overhaul.
Interior Condition
Provision: The interior of the Aircraft shall be in good condition, clean, and free from any damage
beyond normal wear and tear. Seats, flooring, lavatories, and other cabin components must be fully
functional and meet commercial passenger standards.
Repairs: Any damage to the interior (e.g., torn seats, broken panels) must be repaired at the Lessee’s
expense before return.
Maintenance Compliance
Provision: All scheduled maintenance due during the Lease Term must be completed before the
Aircraft is returned, with no overdue items or deferred maintenance tasks outstanding. The Aircraft
must comply with all airworthiness directives (ADs) and service bulletins(SBs) issued by the relevant
aviation authorities.
Documents: The Lessee must provide complete maintenance recordsfor the Aircraft, engines, and
components, including proof of compliance with all applicable ADs and SBs.
Paint and Livery
Provision: The Aircraftshall be returned either in the Lessee’slivery (if approved by the Lessor) or
repainted in a neutral color agreed upon by both parties. Any custom branding applied during the
Lease Term must be removed prior to return at the Lessee’s cost.
Condition: The paint must be free of significant defects (e.g., peeling, chipping) and suitable for
continued commercial service.
Equipment and Configuration
Provision: The Aircraftmust be returned with all original equipment and configuration as at the time
of delivery, including but not limited to:
Avionicssystems
F2
E2
D2
Seats and interior components
Operationalsafety equipment (e.g., oxygenmasks, life vests).
Missing Items: Any missing equipment or components must be replaced by the Lessee at its own
expense prior to return.
Engine and Component Condition
Provision: All major components, including engines, APU, and landing

chunk-8a0fa8ca3ef7d23089e96317c697b997.content:
be returned with all original equipment and configuration as at the time
of delivery, including but not limited to:
Avionicssystems
F2
E2
D2
Seats and interior components
Operationalsafety equipment (e.g., oxygenmasks, life vests).
Missing Items: Any missing equipment or components must be replaced by the Lessee at its own
expense prior to return.
Engine and Component Condition
Provision: All major components, including engines, APU, and landing gear, shall be within the
operational limitsspecified by the OEM. The engines must be in good operating condition, with no
major repairsrequired for at least 1,500 hours or 750 cycles. The Aircraft must be returned with no
engine or APU exceeding 10% of its allowable time between overhaul (TBO).
Replacement: If any components are beyond the allowed operational limits, the Lessee must replace
them with parts of equal or better value before returning the Aircraft.
Fuel and Fluids
Provision: The Aircraftshall be returned with a minimum fuel quantity sufficient for the ferry flight to
the agreed return location. All necessary hydraulic, oil, and other fluids must be at operational levels.
Location: The Aircraft shall be returned to the Lessor’s designated location, which shall be agreed
upon in writing.
Test Flight and Inspection
Provision: The Lessor shall have the right to conduct or observe a post-return test flight to verify the
condition of the Aircraft. The cost of the test flight shall be borne by the Lessor unless any defects or
issues are discovered during the test flight, in which case the Lessee shall bear the cost of repairs and
the flight.
Inspection: A comprehensive physical and recordsinspection will be conducted by the Lessor or an
independent third-party inspector prior to acceptance of the returned Aircraft.
Return Delays and Penalties
Provision: If the Lessee fails to return the Aircraft by the expiration of the Lease Term, the Lessee
shall pay a daily penalty for each day the Aircraft is overdue, unless mutually agreed upon in writing.
Penalty Rate: $12,000 per day.
Grace Period: A grace period of 5 days may be granted by the Lessor, provided there is a justifiable
cause for the delay.
Final Acceptance and Title Transfer
Provision:Upon satisfactory inspection and acceptance of the Aircraft by the Lessor, the Lessee shall
provide all necessary documentsfor the transfer of operational control back to the Lessor. The
Lessee will be released from any further obligations under the Agreement upon the Lessor’s written
confirmation of acceptance.

Exhibit G
Lease Supplement No. 1
This Lease Supplement No. 1 (“Supplement”) is executed pursuant to the Aircraft Lease Agreement
dated August 10, 2025, between AeroSky Rentals Ltd. ("Lessor") and BlueJet Airways Corp.
("Lessee"). The purpose of this Supplement isto provide additional terms and conditionsfor the
lease of one (1) SkyLiner A350 aircraft bearing Manufacturer’s Serial Number 2098745 and
Registration Number G12345, and to modify certain provisions of the original Lease Agreement as
outlined below.
1. Identification of Aircraft: The Aircraft subject to this Lease Supplement is a SkyLiner A350,
equipped with two (2) Rolls-Royce Trent XWB engines. The Aircraft has been inspected and
determined to be in airworthy condition as of the Delivery Date specified in this Supplement.
The Lessee agrees to lease this specific aircraft in accordance with the terms of the original
Lease Agreement and the modifications set forth herein.
2. Modification of Rent Payment: In addition to the Basic Rentspecified in the Lease
Agreement, the parties agree that an additional maintenance reserve payment of $45,000
per month shall be made by the Lessee, commencing on the first day of the month following
the Delivery Date. This payment shall be made to cover future maintenance costs related to
the Aircraft's engines, airframe, and major components.
3. Lease Term and Extension: The Lease Term for the Aircraft identified in this Supplementshall
be 60 months, beginning on August 10, 2025, and ending on August 10, 2029. The Lessee
shall have the option to extend the Lease Term for an additional 12 months, provided that
written notice is given to the Lessor no later than 90 days before the expiration of the
original Lease Term. Any extension of the Lease Term shall be subject to mutually agreed
terms and conditions.
4. Additional Terms: The provisions of this Lease Supplementshall be deemed to modify and
supplement the terms of the original Lease Agreement. In the event of any inconsistency
between the terms of this Supplement and the Lease Agreement, the terms of this
Supplement shall prevail. All other provisions of the Lease Agreement remain in full force
and effect, and the parties hereby confirm their continued agreement to be bound by its
terms.

Exhibit H
Certificate of Delivery Technical Acceptance
This Certificate of Delivery Technical Acceptance ("Certificate") is executed on this 10th day of August
2025, by and between AeroSky Rentals Ltd., a company organized under the laws of Canada
("Lessor"), and BlueJet Airways Corp., a company organized under the laws of the United Kingdom
("Lessee"), pursuant to the Aircraft Lease Agreement dated August 10, 2025.
1. Aircraft Identification and Delivery:
The Aircraft being delivered under this Certificate is a SkyLiner A350, bearing Manufacturer’s
Serial Number 2098745 and Registration Number G12345, and equipped with two (2) RollsRoyce Trent XWB engines. The Aircraft has been inspected and meets the specifications set
forth in the Lease Agreement. The Aircraft is delivered by

chunk-126b8729a96f5230bcdd0afbc6faa094.content:
the United Kingdom
("Lessee"), pursuant to the Aircraft Lease Agreement dated August 10, 2025.
1. Aircraft Identification and Delivery:
The Aircraft being delivered under this Certificate is a SkyLiner A350, bearing Manufacturer’s
Serial Number 2098745 and Registration Number G12345, and equipped with two (2) RollsRoyce Trent XWB engines. The Aircraft has been inspected and meets the specifications set
forth in the Lease Agreement. The Aircraft is delivered by the Lessor and accepted by the
Lessee at Toronto Pearson International Airport, Canada, on this date.
2. Technical Inspection and Acceptance:
The Lessee has conducted a thorough technical inspection of the Aircraft, including a review
of the maintenance records, operational performance, and compliance with airworthiness
directives. Based on this inspection, the Lessee confirms that the Aircraft is in airworthy
condition and meets the delivery conditions specified in the Lease Agreement. All systems,
components, and avionics are functional, and no significant defects were identified during
the inspection process.
3. Certification of Compliance:
The Aircraft is certified as compliant with the applicable regulations and airworthiness
standards of the Transport Canada Civil Aviation (TCCA) and the Federal Aviation
Administration (FAA). The Lessee acknowledges receipt of all relevant documents, including
the Certificate of Airworthiness, maintenance logs, service bulletins, and inspection records.
The Aircraft is delivered with no outstanding airworthiness directives or deferred
maintenance items.
4. Acceptance by Lessee:
The Lessee hereby acknowledges and accepts delivery of the Aircraft in accordance with the
terms of the Lease Agreement. By signing this Certificate, the Lessee confirms that the
Aircraft is in satisfactory condition for commercial operations and that all technical
conditions of the Lease have been met. This Certificate shall serve as evidence of the formal
delivery of the Aircraft to the Lessee, effective as of August 10, 2025.

Exhibit I
Certificate of Redelivery Technical Acceptance
This Certificate of Redelivery Technical Acceptance ("Certificate") is executed on this 10th day of
August 2025, by and between AeroSky Rentals Ltd., a company organized under the laws of Canada
("Lessor"), and BlueJet Airways Corp., a company organized under the laws of the United Kingdom
("Lessee"), pursuant to the Aircraft Lease Agreement dated August 10, 2025.
1. AircraftIdentification and Redelivery:
The Aircraft subject to redelivery under this Certificate is a SkyLiner A350, bearing
Manufacturer’s Serial Number 2098745 and Registration Number G12345, and equipped
with two (2) Rolls-Royce Trent XWB engines. The Aircraft has been inspected and returned by
the Lessee to the Lessor at Toronto Pearson International Airport, Canada, in accordance
with the redelivery termsspecified in the Lease Agreement.
2. Technical Inspection and Redelivery Conditions:
The Lessee has conducted all necessary maintenance, repairs, and inspections prior to
redelivery, and the Aircraft isreturned in an airworthy condition, free from any liens or
encumbrances. The Lessor has conducted a technical inspection of the Aircraft, which
includes:
o Review of the airframe, engines, and landing gear cycles and hours.
o Inspection of the Aircraft’s interior, avionicssystems, and other operational
components.
o Verification that the Aircraft complies with all relevant airworthiness directives(ADs),
service bulletins (SBs), and regulatory requirements.
The Aircraft isfound to be in compliance with the redelivery conditions asstipulated in the Lease
Agreement.
3. Certification of Compliance:
The Aircraft is certified as compliant with the applicable regulations of Transport Canada Civil
Aviation (TCCA) and the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). The Lessee has provided all
necessary documentation, including the updated Certificate of Airworthiness, logbooks,
maintenance records, service history, and weight and balance reports. No significant defects
or overdue maintenance items were identified during the redelivery inspection.
4. Acceptance by Lessor:
The Lessor hereby acknowledges and acceptsthe redelivery of the Aircraft in accordance
with the terms of the Lease Agreement. The Aircraft is accepted in satisfactory condition for
future operations, and all technical and maintenance conditionsrequired for redelivery have
been met. This Certificate shall serve asformal evidence of the Aircraft’s redelivery to the
Lessor as of August 10, 2025.

Exhibit J
Deregistration Power of Attorney
This Deregistration Power of Attorney ("Power of Attorney") is executed on this August 10, 2025, by
BlueJet Airways Corp., a company organized under the laws of the United Kingdom ("Lessee"), in
favor of AeroSky Rentals Ltd., a company organized under the laws of Canada ("Lessor").
1. Appointment and Authority
The Lessee hereby irrevocably appointsthe Lessor, its directors, officers, and any designated
representatives, as its true and lawful attorney-in-fact with full power and authority to act in the
name and on behalf of the Lessee for the sole purpose of effectuating the deregistration of the
Aircraft described below from the Civil Aviation Authority of Ireland and any other applicable aviation
registry.

chunk-a4fe1b907d49f6371a20756523a22bd7.content:
company organized under the laws of Canada ("Lessor").
1. Appointment and Authority
The Lessee hereby irrevocably appointsthe Lessor, its directors, officers, and any designated
representatives, as its true and lawful attorney-in-fact with full power and authority to act in the
name and on behalf of the Lessee for the sole purpose of effectuating the deregistration of the
Aircraft described below from the Civil Aviation Authority of Ireland and any other applicable aviation
registry.
2. AircraftIdentification
This Power of Attorney appliesto the following aircraft("Aircraft"):
 Aircraft Model: SkyLiner A350
 Manufacturer’s Serial Number: 2098745
 Registration Number: G12345
 Engines: Two (2) Pratt & Whitney PW4000 engines
3. Scope of Powers
The Lessor is hereby granted full authority to perform any and all acts necessary to deregister the
Aircraft, including but not limited to:
 Filing applications, forms, and documents with the relevant civil aviation authorities or
governmental entities.
 Executing and delivering any documentsrequired to complete the deregistration process.
 Taking any actionsreasonably necessary to effectuate the export of the Aircraft, if applicable.
 Signing any letters, declarations, or certificationsrequired for deregistration.
4. Effective Date and Duration
This Power of Attorney shall become effective on the date of execution and shall remain in full force
and effect until such time asthe Aircraft has been fully deregistered from the applicable aviation
registry. The Lessee expressly waives any right to revoke this Power of Attorney prior to the
completion of the deregistration process.
5. Indemnity
The Lessee agreesto indemnify and hold harmless the Lessor, its officers, and representativesfrom
any liabilities, claims, or damages arising out of actions taken in good faith under this Power of
Attorney in connection with the deregistration of the Aircraft.
6. Governing Law
J2
This Power of Attorney shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of UK,
without regard to its conflicts of law principles.
